Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: FP4BMO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this particular hotel likely 8-10 times over the past 6 years when we fly out of Seatac for vacation. We keep coming back becuase the level of service, staff professionalism and courteousness is a constant. Our room this time was 2 queen room, great beds, room that served our family of 3. The bathroom was clean and tidy with basic toiletries if needed. We did not take advantage of the breakfast this time but have in the past and it has always been good. The big seller for us on this hotel is the park and fly program, we stay the night, they keep the car for the week, in our case it was 12 days and there was no additional charge. My one concern this time is the restaurant on site, they have moved away from a traditional sit down environment where you order off the menu with a waitress to a system now where you walk in, look at the large order board at the cash register, order all items at one time, pay and then seat yourself. The menu is not quite at extensive as it has been in the past, still quite good but the overall process left a little to be desired. Would this one change make me look elsewhere the next time I travel from Seatac, probably not, my son loves the pool, the price for the night is great and the staff truly appreciate you. When we were it was the start of spring break and thankfully there wasn't a hoard of children running around and there wasn't any excessive noise in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our family”
Reviews.Author: Michelleruss
Reviews.Content: High marks for airport shuttle and breakfast. Good customer service and decent parking rates. Pool was fairly cold on this trip but was better on previous trip. Room was a little noisy as we could hear the people above us moving around with lots of squeaks. Close to Safeway and McDonalds if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: CrochetAddict
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on a cheap price we were able to get on Priceline.com and on the TripAdvisor rating. It was a good place to stay a night. The pool was good and the hot tub was nice too. I really loved the breakfast that was complimentary with our stay. There was lots of space for people to sit. The only recommendation that I would give is to avoid any rooms facing the street. The windows and patio doors aren't very sound-proof, so you could hear the road traffic . It wasn't really an issue for me personally as I sleep with earplugs but it could be a big issue for people that are sensitive to sound at night. The other benefit to staying here is that you can park your vehicle here while you are away for a week on your holidays. I would consider staying here if I should ever fly out of Sea-Tac Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaB212
Reviews.Content: The room was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. It was clean and comfortable. We stayed there overnight before heading out for Hawaii the next morning so we were able to take advantage of the park and fly option. We will stay here again the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: dbozzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Thursday, February 23rd for one night. We had an early AM flight out of Seattle, and choose the park, stay and fly package. We we're able to park our car for 7 days, which was included in the price of the room, then paid for an extra two days at $10 per day. We were also able to book the shuttle to the airport at check-in which was handy. The room was average, but the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. My only concern was that the window had sheers, but no curtains, so the room was quite bright from the lights outside. When we got up and checked out of the room at 4am, we were pleasantly surprised that they had coffee, juice, muffins and fruit in the lobby! We weren't expecting anything at this earlier hour, so it was a nice touch! The shuttle was on time and got us to the airport very quickly. When we returned from our vacation, we got the shuttle back to the hotel and picked up our car. We had no issues and the car was there waiting for us in the parking lot, just as we left it. All in all it was a pleasant stay. I would recommend this hotel for anyone needing an overnight stay with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Marc S
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at what I thought would be an average hotel. I was on my way to China, and found out the next morning that I wasn't as prepared as I thought I was. I learned that I would need to buy a new phone in order to have service in China. I spoke with Darryl, the shuttle driver, and he said that he knew of a store that should be able to help me. He took me to the store, and dropped me off, agreeing to pick me up on his next trip from the airport. After getting picked up and back to the hotel, I found out that the prepaid phone that I had bought would also be useless overseas. Not wanting to bother the driver anymore, I went down to ask for a cab so I could go to a radio shack store. He saw me and told me that I don't need to pay for a cab, as he is willing to take me there, and pick me up again. Long story short, he went above and beyond to make me comfortable, and greatly reduced the time it would have taken me to do all of this 3 hours before my international flight. He also had some great stories to tell and made me feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Homeless”
Reviews.Author: alice b
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay here unless you do not mind having your stuff stolen from your room. I had a bag containing electronics (iPod, Sony Personal Play Station, lap top computer, etc.) stolen from the room. Surprisingly they found the lap top out by the dumpster, so I did get that back. The hotel was not willing to claim any responsibility as well as their insurance company (over $750 of electronics). The manager was not being proactive in helping me recover the items. However, they did admit that they had a homless in the hotel that they had to call the police to help remove - and the day we had our bag stolen at that. This is not a safe hotel and not in a good part of town. Spend a little extra money to go to a safer area - not down by the airport. The staff was nice, but niceness only goes a short distance.

Reviews.Title: “Curtains did not close or block street lights!”
Reviews.Author: Missy454
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and helpful. I am in my room right now with my husband and daughter who are both fast asleep. The problem is that the thicker curtains do not close or cover the window and they are only for show. The street lights are shining into my room directly in my face through the flimsy sheers. I am in room number 153. I like to face the side the window is on while sleeping and for this reason I will have a very uncomfortable and disruptive sleep. I Can't do much about it at this time since I'm exhausted and the rest of my family is sound asleep. Rooms are kind of small but they are clean. I'm not happy that the hotel is too cheap to have curtains that close all the way! Wifi is too slow here and my emails take forever to open and send.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park & Stay Package”
Reviews.Author: Suzannewood
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with our experience here. We had booked this hotel because of the price but were very pleasantly surprised with the service, really great breakfast and room. The room looked like it had been recently renovated. It was great having the shuttle take us back and forth to the airport as well. Great value for cost.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: DenverBobH
Reviews.Content: Had to come to Seattle on business for an extended stay and chose this hotel based on cost and convenience. When I got here, I found a great room with a very comfortable bed and a staff that is more than accommodating. The room was quiet, even being relatively close to the south end of the runway for the airport. If you have to come to the SeaTac area, this is a great value that delivers comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but confirm your billing!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3283
Reviews.Content: Great Value to stay overnight before your vacation,,,"Park & Stay package" includes free parking for a week and an airport shuttle, very accommodating staff! Billing...You be the judge... WITHOUT PREJUDICE: Ms. Trudeau, My reservation that was booked was booked for $79 plus tax for the complete park and fly package. If my reservation was only changed after check-in to seperate the parking part of my stay, and the room part of my stay because you billed it at 2 seperate tax rates, then why would you leave the separated rate of $79.00 plus tax posted to my online account without posting the other part of the charge that you say was for the parking portion. Perhaps, the Best Western website does not allow you to post this breakdown onto a clients account, as this would cause less confusion. I haven never had this type of error with any of the six hotel chains that I hold memberships with. As this was my first stay with your chain, I can only conclude that it is more important to defend your errors than to satisfy a potential future guest. Again, I was completely satisfied with your efficient and friendly staff, along with the cleanliness and comfort of the room, but your explanation of why my account only shows the rate of $79.00 plus tax leaves me wondering how a hotel chain, as well known as yours, could let something like this happen. I can only hope such future occurances with other guests will warrant changes to your billing practices. Sincerely, William Roy Codling ------------------------------------ Mr. Codling, Your reservation that was booked was booked at the rate of $119 plus tax, which is also what you signed for at check-in, and is our regular park and fly rate. Your reservation was only changed after check-in to seperate the parking part of your stay, and the room part of your stay because they are billed at 2 seperate tax rates, which is why it would show, after your check-in that your reservation was billed at $79, the parking does not show on the room rate portion of best western reservation information.Â  I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: Sharon P
Reviews.Content: To park your car there for a week and get a room for the night with a full continental breakfast and free shuttle service to an dfrom Seatac for about $140 is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking, Good Wifi, Food onsite, & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: mcksh
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here several times a month for the last 4 months and I've come to appreciate it. The rooms aren't fancy, and I wish the linens were nicer, but the consistent positives have led me to make standing reservations at the Executel rather than play roulette with priceline - which I did for 2 years prior. Here's what I appreciate. Free parking. Free Wifi that's fast enough to stream movies. Free breakfast in the morning and simple dinners with bar service available at night. The king rooms are nicely sized. I wish the outlets were built into the bedside lamps, but other than that - it's a good stay. A very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy.”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper9008
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but well worth the money and very convenient to the airport. The staff was wonderful. Very friendly and eager to help with anything to make my visit to Seattle easier.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to make good...”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel for the Stay, Park and Fly. We've booked here before, and there was always free parking while we were away at least for the first week with a marginal charge per day for the second week, if you booked the night before you left on vacation and the night you returned. We didn't know that the policy had changed. There is a charge for parking per day, which we found out when we came back. The front desk person really did try to make us feel better by giving us a discounted rate and room upgrade for the return overnight stay, and she truly did make us feel better somehow without apologizing! Overall, I would stay here again, but would research it better and not assume that everything remains the same. Hotel is clean, front staff and restaurant staff are friendly. Rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always.”
Reviews.Author: Larry O
Reviews.Content: We always have great service at the Executel Park&Fly. Prompt shuttle service to and from, always courteous and friendly. It seems the Executel is doing something right, the parking lots are always full! Our past two trips have been very early in the morning so we missed the breakfast but the coffee in the lobby really helped, sure beat the coffee in the rooms. Our latest trip and flight out was later, so we enjoyed the breakfast hosted by Catherine. One thing however, please relay to guests parking overnight, please tell them to park within the designated white lines in the rear parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Park”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed twice at this Best Western. We park there, spend the night, return a week later, spend another night and pick up our car. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the wifi works, the breakfast is good, and the hotel staff, both behind the counter and the drivers, are friendly and considerate. The only small complaint I have is that the TV is angled in such a way that you can't watch from bed.

Reviews.Title: “Darryl”
Reviews.Author: Orcasgirl2
Reviews.Content: In October, 2011 my husband and I stayed here / left our car for a week while we traveled to San Diego. As always, the hotel was clean. We had a light dinner in the restaurant and breakfast the next morning. When we arrived back in Seattle, Darryl picked us up at the airport and took us back to our car. My husband left his backpack in the shuttle van and we didn't notice it until we got home which is about 100 miles away. He called the hotel and the backpack was there. Darryl had retrieved. The next day, the hotel mailed it back to us. We have stayed here many times and Darryl is always so nice to everyone on the shuttle. The kids love him and we are lucky to have him there. Thanks, Darryl! Sharon Mudd

Reviews.Title: “Service was epic failure.”
Reviews.Author: DReveler
Reviews.Content: When I arrived on Jan. 20th the front desk was clearly struggling. The was a high influx of visitors due to the snowstorm cutting power and cancelling flights. It took me nearly 20 minutes to get checked in. Once I was finally checked in, my room keys wouldn't work. It took 3 attempts to finally get into our room and each time I had to wait in line again. Exhausted, we decided to just stay in our room and order from the restaurant. We tried to call twice but nobody picked up. Red flag #2. My wife walked over to assess the scene. It was chaotic at best. There was a total of 2 wait staff serving the entire restaurant and bar. There appeared to be a manager present apologizing to tables for the wait. However, they didn't appear to actually be doing anything to help any customers. My wife placed an order because at this point it was getting to late to go anywhere else. It took almost an hour to get our food which was cold and basically inedible. On Saturday our keys quit working and had to be re-keyed to work because the clerk from the night before forgot to set them for our entire stay. Again, I was forced to wait in line for nearly 20 minutes just waiting to try and get back into my room. The clerk took multiple calls and assisted the callers while I waited in line with two other people. Basic customer service principles were just non-existent. The one and only example of good service provided by the operational staff came from Kaisa at checkout. After I told her about our stay she offered a refund of our first night which I appreciated and accepted. If it wasn't for her I would have rated the Overall Score at Terrible. Yeah it was clean and the rooms were pretty basic. I guess if all we were looking for was power, heat and a hot shower then that's what we got. Best Western had an incredible opportunity to turn a really rough day into a pleasant evening and failed to deliver. If it were my hotel, I would fire whoever was supposed to be in charge of the fiasco taking place on Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “close to sea-tac, good shuttle service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: liketravel101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove down from Vancouver and stayed one night here to fly to Kona from Seattle. We were happy with everything. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Our room was clean and quiet, and we had a nice sleep. Wi-fi in the room was really fast. Breakfast was not fancy, but still good and it was included in your room. The parking lot has decent number of spots. It was pretty full but there were still a few available spots. The lot looks safe. We parked our car there for 10 days and it was all good when we returned. Its location is very close the to airport, about 5 mins drive. Shuttle service was excellent, polite driver, on-time. We only waited for about 10 mins at the airport and the shuttle showed up. If you want to do sea-tac sleep and fly, I highly recommend best western airport executel.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Driver Darryl was great!”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Our shuttle driver, Darryl, was very personable and got us to SeaTac Airport in great time. We always enjoy staying at this hotel, and Darryl is an example of the great service they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the area”
Reviews.Author: qman55
Reviews.Content: Ecomonical stay. even though it is a few blocks more from the airport but worth it. Free wi fi, parking and morning breakfast buffet. clean room and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: riderfan20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to Hawaii....the staff were great, right from the shuttle driver to the front desk staff. Great breakfast, clean and tidy rooms. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “A restful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lahclay
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this location as it was very economical, the staff was friendly and the transportation staff were very supportive, and knowledgeable. Recommendations from one of the drivers (James) and a couple of others seemed to be very knowlegeable regarding the many sites to visit, locations to get your choice cuisines, and where to play in Seattle, WA. The shuttle driver, James recommended a wonderful little seafood restaurant, dropped us off at the location and we celebrated our anniversary in a place that had a very nice ambiance. We enjoyed the very coordial staff, their patience with those of us that were trying to get adjusted to an unfamilar place. Rooms were clean, bed was good, the restaurant served a good variety on their breakfast menu. It was a plus to have a refrigerator in the room, would liked to have had a microwave in the room, next time, the large TV was also nice. Enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi, and had a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Goldenlocks2
Reviews.Content: I had asked for a handicap room after having had hip replacement surgery and they took very good care of me. The room was very clean and equipped with microwave, refrigerator and TV. Nice big bathroom and comfortable bed. I was at the end of the hall and heard nothing at any time. Was able to rest comfortably. The flight on US Airways was just the opposite. I needed to come home a day early due to illness and had already paid $629.00 roundtrip and they told me about the $150.00 extra charge but didn't advise me of the Add'l $207.00 they charged me for what they claimed the ticket cost would have been on that day. This isn't the first time they've ripped me off either. I hope I never have to use them again. Cost me $986.00 to go to Seattle and come home a day early, I had already paid for my ticket. They are a bunch of rip-offs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leahb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Executel Hotel prior to a very early morning flight out of Seatac in Nov 2011. Our reservation was great, had a great rate for a king bed room, thanks to Elizabeth, who honoured a price match online!!! We arrived on Thanksgiving Day and they gave us a great recommendation for a great restaurant for a thanksgiving dinner. Their shuttle driver actually drove us there and picked us up from the restaurant!!! (13 Coins - great restaurant and great food). The room was good, bed good, and they gave us an early 3:30 am wake up call and their shuttle driver was ready to roll right on time! They had muffins and fruit and coffee in the lobby at that early hour, which was awesome, and we had an uneventful short ride to the airport. We parked our car at the hotel for the two weeks we were gone and upon return, their shuttle picked us up without problem and delivered us right back to our car!!! We also enjoyed a lovely hot tub there! We would DEFINITELY stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Skyrider”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Outstanding front desk, and most especially, the assistance I received from Jim, the shuttle driver on 12/27 when he took me to the irport. I am a leg amputee, and require special assistance. Jim's help[ was valuable, and helped me make my check-in more rapid and smooth. The breakfast was surprisingly full, and more than met my expectatins. Delicious!.I think the handicapped room(s) could be located closer to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Would so stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SheepyVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: My husband, and I wanted to do something different for New Years with the children (9and 11) so we decided to pack up and go to Seattle! I booked this Hotel on "hotels.com" and got two nights for $160.00. I didn't realize we weren't right in Seattle until after I booked it, but it didn't matter. We werere only a 15 to 20 minute car ride away! This hotel was very clean. The continental breakfast was the best I have ever seen in a hotel. The pool was great for the kids. Nice hot tub for us. This is a very "kid friendly" hotel. There are alot of kids here. They do run up and down the hallways (mine included) and you can hear them up above as you walk down the halls. But, with that said, once inside the rooms, you don't hear a thing. Not even the planes that fly up above. The only complaint I have is the heater in our room was very loud. What we did was crank up the heat while we were out all day and turned it off at bed time. The room was toasty until morning. I would definately stay here again, the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly for the family.”
Reviews.Author: bristlebeard
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a decent place for a family to check out Seattle and surroundings for a couple of nights. The hotel room was basic but good and clean. The pool was okay, hot tub was nice and the games room worked fine for us. The complimentary breakfast was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: bob z
Reviews.Content: i have spent many nights at this property and they have always been exceptional. recently i had the pleasure of staying and requested information about the shower heads.... my wife and i recently purchased a home and the shower heads used here are what i wanted in my home....elizabeth responded to an email inquiry rapidly and with more information than i expected.... she not only identified the manufacturer but also the part number and where it could be purchased......... FANTASTIC!!!!! as for the accommodations: always clean and comfortable..... the people friendly and helpful.... i have no complaints..... to be perfect i would suggest updating the restaurant menu and perhaps expanding it having said that the restaurant is adequate and the food worthy...... prices a little high but for the convenience not bad fries are terrific!!! and a meal in themself.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: waltrude
Reviews.Content: The good: Convenient, cheap place for sleeping between flights. Nice staff, free shuttle. The restaurant makes a surprisingly good BLT: good bread, lots of fresh L &T, really nice B. The free breakfast buffet includes a make-your-won-waffle station. The bad: It basically looks like a motel, which is a little depressing. The room was reasonably comfortable, but the heater made clicking sounds during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent family stay”
Reviews.Author: Norrisrock
Reviews.Content: Have taken the family there many times while transitting Seatac. This is a hub hotel that works hard to do extra for a very busy coast last airport. The drivers are cordial and the stay is clean and affordable for the purpose. I have no desire to go elsewhere while going out of Seattle. Great rates for parking as well that you should not discount given that parking has become an industry in other nearby urban venues.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, helpful staff, free shuttle, complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: terracore
Reviews.Content: Great service started with the shuttle driver. Offered us all kinds of information about the area and the hotel and gave us lots of help with our bags. Check-in was slow due to long line and only one employee, but employee was very helpful. Got a snack and a few drinks before the restaurant closed at 10:00pm. For a Best Western, the room was nicely updated. Large granite bathroom countertop in the larger-than-expected bathroom, new furnishings, beds, and bedding inside, dare I say almost a Hiltonesque look to it. It had a private balcony overlooking a parking lot. Didn't use the balcony on the short "layover" stay but did verify the locks on the door worked well. The complimentary all-you-can-eat breakfast was better than expected. Hot and cold food options, fresh fruit, cold and hot drinks. Was really surprised at the quality. The only real "cons" I can think of was that there was really nothing of interest around the hotel. I asked the hotel if there was a convenience store nearby and was told it wasn't safe to walk there but they would be happy to give me a free ride. +1 for the free ride offer, -1 for the sketchy neighborhood. Another con was all the hallway noise. Both people talking were very loud and the room doors slammed very loud. Whenever somebody in the hallway came or left their room the door slammed loudly, waking us up. The only other negative was that the business center had no internet. I don't know if it was just "down" during my stay but I tried all 3 computers and none of them had internet. The free return shuttle to the airport left right on time. Every part of the hotel was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the complimentary breakfast was great, and the rooms were nicely updated and decorated. This hotel has a great value and I would stay here again. I was treated like a valued customer throughout my stay by every employee. The hotel management has done a really good job ensuring a very high level of service, far beyond what you would expect at a "budget" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in the Cafe”
Reviews.Author: SteveEEEohhh
Reviews.Content: Hi and Thanks! A Grrreat stay, the only issue We had was in the Cafe, the Waitress/bartender Chris was Rude and very unpleasant, to not only us but the others in the room, for instance, I got up to go help other travelers in the hallway and she marched over and told me to "Go sit down and eat my food" I said I'm just trying to help these folks and She pointed at my seat and said GO.. We got our food and left the restaurant immediately. After 32 Years in the Boat business with 13 stores, I've learned a little about Customer Service, and one Bad Apple causes Many to "Not reach into the Basket". If she is working, we'll find another place3 to eat, rather than subject ourselves to more Punishment! I have never met her before and do Not know her. I have Nothing personal against her, I just thought I'd try and let You know it may be time for a review! She was "snapping at other patrons as well" Lynn at the Front desk and Both Your drivers got tips from Us, as well as housekeeping, they are both kind and attentive! A real plus for Your Property! Blessings and Merry Christmas!! Steven A Eason Premier America (360)489-5840

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLRTrail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after a 2 weeks holiday in the Dominican. We left our car parked here for the 2 weeks and got a great rate. The hotel is very clean, the beds were comfortable and the service was great!! Breakfast the next morning was amazing...great variety, delicious food...my boys left full, and that is hard to do! The shuttle to and from the airport was efficient and the driver James was very friendly. If I ever fly out of Seattle again, this is my hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One Night - Good Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jon D
Reviews.Content: I got in late, but had an easy time checking in. I was very comfortable and slept well. The breakfast was good, not spectacular, but I didn't go away hungry or disappointed. I am in Seattle once a month for business and will definitely use the Executel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not going back even if it was inexpensive ....”
Reviews.Author: bexnate
Reviews.Content: The Best Western near Seatac seemed like a good choice because I had to work at the airport but I was disappointed. The room was huge but terribly furnished, looked like stuff from Goodwill. The tiny TV was about a mile from the bed! The shower drain was mildewed. The continental breakfast was the only good feature. Service was adequate, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best at SeaTac!”
Reviews.Author: WoolleyLady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Best Western Airport Executel before. Everyone is friendly and very professional. The rooms are always clean, quiet and comfortable. I have used the stay and park and have never had a bit of trouble. The shuttle is quick and when picking up your car, will deliver you right to your car. Never stayed for breakfast (always leave too early) but they have muffins and coffee prior to their breakfast. Drivers always help you with your luggage unlike some of the other shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Great start”
Reviews.Author: Susan I
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night prior to a weeks vacation to the east coast. Very friendly staff at the front desk. Room was clean and comfortable. Darryl our shuttle driver was excellent he knows how to make an early morning run to the airport enjoyable. Great start to our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Abzats
Reviews.Content: Close to sea-tac airport, free airport shuttle, free breakfast, good rate. Clean, good size comfortable room. Best of all - friendly, professional stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Sea-Tac”
Reviews.Author: BillC336
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for early morning flights, or late arrivals. An older property that needs a face lift. While being adequate for over nighting prior to an early morning flight, the room was a typical older airport hotel room.The service was good from the shuttle drivers to the wait staff in the restaurant. The menu in the restaurant at the time of our visit was limited in selections. However, we were told that a revamp which will add more and varied selections is forthcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Seatac Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terry C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way down and back from Fort Lauderdale. Great pick up service from and to Seatac. Nice little Restaurant doubles as breakfast bar in the morning and a small Bar in the evening. Kids loved the waffle maker. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, unconcerned staff”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: Our room had no hot water whatsoever. After reporting the problem to the front desk, we were told "tough luck", that there were no other rooms available and that the hot water problem wouldn't be fixed before we checked out the next day. In fact, an entire wing of the hotel was without hot water. We were given no apologies and a rude response from the staff. After complaining at length, we were begrudgingly offered a puny $15 discount on our room, which didn't begin to compensate for the lack of hot water, which should be an absolute basic! In addition, the fact that we're Best Western Rewards members meant nothing to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: traveller52Bc
Reviews.Content: i spent a couple of nights here at the end of my vacation to Florida. From the shuttle driver to the restaurant workers, the whole place was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was great with everything you need for a good breakfast. I ate two nights at the restaurant and found the food good and the prices reasonable. i didn't have a car but the shopping centre has a free shuttle that was very good and there is a bus line across the street. The hotel is older but clean. I also found the business center with computer access to be a helpful addition.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and Park”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples taking an early flight out of SEATAC in Oct. 2011. We booked 2 rooms, 1 on their program which allowed us to park our car for 2 weeks. The hotel has great beds, plenty of food for breakfast, and an efficient shuttle to the airport. Upon our return, the shuttle driver James picked us up and drove us right to our car to unload our luggage. We will happily do this again rather than dealing with a hotel and different parking facility. And it was cheaper, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great option before flying!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi383
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, but very nice, hotel with a great option to park for up to a week (pre-arrange) as part of your night's stay cost -- good for flying! Very trustworthy shuttle (thanks James!) even on a cold night. Refrigerator in room! restaurant and bar ON PREMISES! Great bedding, too. I recommend! Oh, also good restaurants nearby if you don't want to eat on-premises: Recommend Sharp's Roast house, less than 2 miles up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lindag717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently at the start and end of our vacation. The first stay went perfect. Shuttle from the airport was quick and the driver was very friendly filling us in about possible places for dinner and where he could take us etc. The hotel is older, but our room was clean and had everything we needed. Free internet is always a plus. We ate dinner at the restaurant on site and although it wasn't outstanding, it was ok and was priced adequately. The menu was fairly limited though. The continental breakfast was nice. It was probably one of the better complimentary ones I've seen. Unfortunately, our second trip didn't work out quite as well. We were picked up promptly at the airport. However, when we arrived at the hotel at midnight. We discovered that there were no rooms with hot water. There was another guest at the front desk who was very upset and the desk clerk was completly overwhelmed with what to do. Fortunately the shuttle driver stepped in and tried to get everything under control - he is really an asset to this hotel, but unfortunately I forgot his name. He suggested taking us to a nearby hotel, with the same owner, where we would be much happier. I am very grateful that he was around as I don't think we would have gotten much satisfaction from the front desk attendant. I think good customer service would have been to give a courtesy call to those of us with reservations giving us a heads up before we arrived. Phone numbers are required when making reservations. There are so many choices of hotels when flying in and out of seatac not sure I would risk this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: peaceprize
Reviews.Content: We had airport pickup - driver very friendly and helpful to all passengers. Hotel staff friendly. Onsite restaurant/bar convenient. Free shuttle to & from the shopping center also convenient. Room was clean and quiet. Complimentary wireless internet access & non smoking both appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: prevostpilot
Reviews.Content: from the moment i walked thru the front door the staff was amazing the room was very clean and the bed and pillows were so comfy the van drivers awesome had a great nites sleep there wish all hotels were up to what they are i would def. stay again if back at seatac

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth R
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The hotel was very quiet. I was worried that we would hear a lot of the airplanes, but that wasn't the case. The hotel was very clean and all of the staff was very friendly. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place - shuttle a plus”
Reviews.Author: psutraveler55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a visit to Seattle. The plus for us was free shuttle to the Light Rail system and the airport. The shuttle and drivers were awesome. The left the hotel every half-hour (make a reservation, they'll look for you before leaving) but pick you up whenever you call. It's about a 10 minute ride to the airport. The light rail to downtown ran very often, was clean and quiet. I think it took about 30 minutes to get to downtown. The room was fine - pool great (and almost no one used it -don't worry there is a camera watching from the desk) - wireless access or complimentary computer access - breakfast was fine. We were told later that this is not an area to be walking in after dark - not a problem for me - I'd rather be swimming. A very helpful clerk even printed our boarding passes for us when we couldn't get the printer in the computer room to work.

Reviews.Title: “Responsive Managment”
Reviews.Author: Katied00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for a stay&fly prior to our 2 week trip to California and Mexico. I booked online and was quoted a very good price. When we checked out there was some confusion on the price. I ended up paying more than the quote (granted it was only a couple dollars more). When I filled out the survey sent by the hotel I mentioned the issue. I received a very nice note from the property manager, Elizabeth Trudeau, along with a credit for the overcharge amount. I appreciated her quick response and the credit. Without going into great detail it had to do with the amount of taxes paid. As for the property itself, we found the room to be very clean and comfortable. We were able to use the wireless internet which was very convenient. In the morning we at a quick (free) breakfast before boarding the shuttle. We did reserve this the night before. The shuttle was on time. We did see a couple come out just after he pulled away and he went back for them. Upon our return, James picked us up from the airport and drove us right up to our car which was waiting safe and sound. He was very personable and efficient at his job. I would not hesitate to stay at this property again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Driver”
Reviews.Author: lstowe93
Reviews.Content: The shuttle driver James was very kind and had outstanding customer service! He was very timely to pick us up at the airport, and when we returned to BW to pick up our car, he offered to drive us to it rather than dropping us at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied, great value”
Reviews.Author: hiquest
Reviews.Content: When I made this reservation, I was a little apprehensive because the price was at the lower end of my price range. My wife and I were very pleasantly surprised at how spacious, clean, and well-furnished the room was. Service at check-in was efficient and friendly. The airport shuttle was run 24-hours which took the worry off having to leave for a very early flight. While we did not partake of the complimentary breakfast, hot and cold beverages and light snacks were made available before we took the 4:30 AM shuttle to the airport. The only inconvenience we experienced was the TV was being located to the side of the bed in the work area which made viewing from the bed awkward ... but this was of the lowest priority for us. Above all, the value provided was excellent ($81.21 including tax). We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, reasonably priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Davo J
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year because it's the only place near the airport that let's us leave our car -- at a fair price -- there while we take our vacation. Clean, comfortable beds, great shuttle service. Only suggestion: the place looks pretty spartan. Spice it up with some better pictures; some color (so it's more appealing; not so boring :)).

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: maudes
Reviews.Content: james the shuttle driver was most helpful. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Some great services in a physically average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ellyn T
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel recently and once in the past when flying in and out of Seattle. They offer a park and fly option, very good free breakfast, shuttle service, and are far enough from the airport not to be noisy. The desk staff have been welcoming and friendly on all occasions. Physically, this hotel is rather dated and the rooms nothing special. One of the toasters in the breakfast area was not working due to a missing handle and was still in this condition when we returned two weeks later. The shuttle driver we had when we returned was very friendly and helpful with our luggage. For a nice tip, he put all the luggage (we had a lot) on the cart and took it to our room and unloaded it. The room and bathroom were very clean. I would not want to stay on the bottom floor as we were able to walk right in the side door off the parking lot without needing to use our key. This was in the morning. It was locked the night before, but still doesn't seem like a good idea to have access to the hallway and therefore rooms that easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to have breakfast ready early”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessGuy
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious room but the layout makes it almost impossible to watch TV from the bed -- if that's what you want to do. Excellent Stay, Park & Fly package. We had to leave on a 5am shuttle and breakfast was already available. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and Post Cruise Stays”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: Facility was clean, rooms were modern, spacious and clean. Staff was helpful but sparse. Many customers appeared to be cruise passengers, who arrived prior to official check-in time. Would be nice to have a secure area for bag storage, so lobby wasn't crowded with people and suitcases waiting several hours to check in. Elevator is small, baggage trolley barely fits in it. Could use more organization in airport shuttle process, as many people without reservations took spaces for those who had them. Cafe staff was very gracious and food was good and not overpriced. One of the better BW facilities we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good lodgings but..”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at both ends of a recent trip. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. I would have rated this higher but we had dinner on our return after a long day. We arrived at the entrance and it took over 10 minutes to seat us. Once we were seated we waited about another 10 minutes to be served. Our dinner took about 1/2 hour to come. We spent a total of about 1 hour and 20 minutes on a meal that should have been 40 minutes at most. There are no other restaurants close by or we would have left. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience with service”
Reviews.Author: seemore68
Reviews.Content: The front desk ladies (Lena, Natasha & Kasai) were all very helpful & accomodating. The evening meal in the restaurant was a pleasant surprise. It is a small place but had a good menu for a place that is competing with Seattle restaurants. The breakfast was very satisfactory. Plenty of items including eggs. Sea-Tac Airport is near-by for convenience.The shuttle runs 24/7. The Business Center is open 24/7 using your room key. I was particularly impressed with how clean the updated bathroom was as well as the bed linens. The exterior does not grab your attention. But the service and ammenities are all there. I had requested a room on the top floor away from the ice machine and elevator. I was given an inside room on the 2nd (top) floor overlooking the garden. Very quiet. As a woman traveling alone, I felt very comfortable moving about in the hotel. I will definitely stay there again whenever the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Best Western airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charleegee
Reviews.Content: Okay hotel, okay location. Served the purpose for one night. Dinner is very ordinary. The only thing that was a rank above was the free breakfast the next morning which included eggs, waffles, sausages.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but neat and clean.”
Reviews.Author: imln
Reviews.Content: We stayed prior to, and following, a cruise and were very happy with what we got for the price. We booked through the 1-800 number and were served by a very helpful gentleman who got us the 'fly, stay, and cruise' package -- includes the shuttle to the ship (savings of $12 p.p.). The hotel is older, but has newly renovated bathrooms, comfortable beds, is neat and clean, and has very helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast is great and is served in a large area that becomes a restaurant in the evening. We stayed 2 nights and it appeared to be a popular place since the breakfast area was packed both mornings. The only downside to this hotel is its location (far from downtown) but they do have a shuttle that will take you to a mall (which we did not use) as well as the free airport shuttle (easy to book at the front desk). We got back early from the cruise, and although our room was not ready, they gave us a secure place to store our luggage and gave us a room as soon as one was cleaned. Excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing for a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: PMYFairfax_CA
Reviews.Content: I am a Best Western Rewards client - always stay at BW whenever I travel because the rooms are always clean, the staff usually helpful, and the facilities are centrally located and well kept. This hotel is none of the above. In the first place, the premises are old, the furniture is worn, the carpets are dirty and the walls are dingy. That could be forgiven were it not for the fact that the staff is unhelpful, with the exception of one shuttle driver and one new receptionist. Examples: there are no instructions posted in the computer room about operating the printer or informing a guest how to log in, which means one has to ask the front desk and if there is only one person there, well, tough luck. When one asks for assistance, the staff behaves as if they are either annoyed or clueless or both. The rooms have been updated but the walls are horridly thin. I asked for a "quiet room" and could still hear normal conversations down the hallway! Finally, guests are not informed that if they want a shuttle to the airport., they must make a reservation! My entire stay there would have been comical if not so horridly inadequate compared with normal Best Western reputation for quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Edward C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in mid August and then 8 nights in September due to hurricane Irene becuase of flight cancellations. The hotel is very well maintained and the housekeeping staff keeps it spotless. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are well cared for. The rooms would benefit by adding a microwave and a better TV with better channel selections. The free breakfast is well done, waffles, eggs, sausage, biscuits, cereral, toast, bagels, juice, coffee, tea, etc. It's best to get there early beacuse the late risers stream in after 9 and the place fills up fast and food bins empty and silverware disappears. The breakfast area also serves as a dining room for dinner and I have to say it's one of the best hotel restuarants I've eaten in. The portions are large and the meals are VERY inexpensive. The two waitresses that served us the 4 times we ate there were the nicest people you could ask to meet. As others have noted, the location is in a semi-industrial area so having a car is a must. There is an IHOP nearby and a Safeway, both within walking distance. Other than that, you're out of luck. The free shuttle is great too, they'll take you to the airport where you can catch the light rail into Seattle and they will also drop you off at a couple of nice restuarants near the airport, 13 Coins and Sharps. Tip the guy a few bucks whenever you ride...they do a great job. I held off giving them 5 stars because we had called ahead the first time we stayed there to make sure we had a roll-away bed in our room since there were 5 of us and when we arrived (at 11:30PM) there was no roll-away bed and none were available. My son had to sleep on the floor on numerous blankets and pillows. They did give us a discount for our troubles though. The jets taking off and landing can be an annoyance at night but I think SeaTac suspends flights overnight. The business center is a good addition too allowing you to use a computer to work or book/confirm flights and print out boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “No soundproofing = no sleep”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterIL
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the worst soundproofing I have ever experienced at a hotel. You can hear every step anyone is taking on your floor (terrible floorboards) and on the floor above. It's NONSTOP footsteps; simply unbearable. The hotel itself is decent and the beds are comfortable (if you can ever fall asleep). The continental breakfast is nice but when we went at 9:10am, the eggs were gone and never got refilled (breakfast was supposed to go on until 9:30am). Also, several barefoot guests - gross. Our bathroom was shower only and there's even a sign detailing how much the guest will be charged for each missing towel. Tacky. The hotel is pretty far south, away from the cluster of SeaTac hotels and dining options, so only stay here if you have a car (at least parking is plentiful). Nice, friendly front desk staff; the housekeeping team seemed to just wish guests would disappear.

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly choose Best Western again.”
Reviews.Author: CalvinN147388
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a relaxing comfortable stay. The rooms are clean , the breakfast was excellent and the staff was helpful. I had an issue with the vouchers for transport to the pier 91 and this was effectively handled by Mr Nadeem Pirani ( General Manager). If you are cruising from seattle this is the place to stay. The free airport shuttle operates like clockwork and the hotel is in a nice,safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, I would come here again”
Reviews.Author: susan j
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. Bathtub was more of a bathtub shower stall. You could hear the airplanes taking off. The pool was under renovation. The continental breakfast was a little better than most. Hotel staff brought a rollaway bed pretty quickly. I would stay here again. It was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Seattle Airport Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: BiorkaBoatRentals
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on a layover and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. They were also very friendly and accommodating. We needed to leave our suitcases at the front desk which of course was no problem but then we also needed to catch a bus to the mall and they went out of their way to make sure we had time to catch the last one of the day. Overall just a clean, friendly place to stay. Would definitley recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, nicer than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: YoMom14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near SEA airport and the free shuttle from airport to hotel was definitely a plus for us. The rooms were clean and pretty much as described on their website. The restaurant is a casual American-style place with surprisingly good coffee and clam chowder, and that's also where the breakfast is served in the morning. We found that the breakfast was extremely crowded and it was hard to find a spot to sit, so get there early to avoid the rush if possible. The food was generous for a free breakfast, though, and included a few hot dishes in addition to the typical cereal, fruit, breads and yogurt. We took the bus into downtown Seattle and there's a bus stop right across the street, so it's a very convenient location if you're looking to travel without a vehicle. The bowl of apples at the front desk was a very nice touch. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good family friendly airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth E
Reviews.Content: Really good family friendly airport hotel. Very easy drive to the Seatac, WA airport. Clean, comfortable, good breakfast, great pool and ping pong table for the kids. The only downer is the location of the elevators. They are not centrally located; so, wheeling the luggage cart around can be cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Somervillemom
Reviews.Content: We arrived here from the airport about midnight, which was 3 am EST according to our bodies. At the airport, we arrived in time for the shuttle to the hotel, but it was packed and there was no room for our families' luggage, so we had to wait for the next shuttle. The driver said he'd be back in 10-15 minutes, but it was half an hour before he appeared again. (This is more in line with the hotel's statement that the shuttle departs every half hour.) Due to this experience, although we were booked to stay at the BW Executel again before our return flight at 7 am, I decided to move to a hotel closer to the airport in case we ran into trouble and had to grab a taxi. However, the hotel itself was fine, if quirky. As others have said, I expected a more upscale place based on the name. Instead, it's a renovated older hotel. We had a room on the 2nd (top) floor, and were told to push 3 in the elevator, which brought us to a hall that was separated from the rest of the 2nd floor by a small stairway. The room (2 queens) was large, but I was so tired while I was there that I didn't register much about it other than that it had a dispenser for soap, shampoo, and conditioner in the shower (see picture) instead of bottles of shampoo and bars of soap. This saves on plastic and unused shampoo, soap, etc., but it was kind of weird. There was one bar of soap provided at the sink, and I used that in the shower too rather than the liquid soap. My daughter and I looked at the pool and exercise room but due to a tight schedule we didn't use either one. The pool is indoors, smallish and kind of kidney shaped, 3 ft to 6 ft deep. There is a courtyard with 2 wings of rooms surrounding it and I saw picnic tables with umbrellas in the courtyard which might have been a nice place to hang out. There's not much of a lobby, but 2 large breakfast rooms, with the standard waffle-maker, etc. large breakfast. The people at the front desk were a bit overworked and harried; there were a lot of people staying here when we were here. Our night was quiet and we slept well, but woke around 8 am since we were still on East Coast time. When we returned from breakfast, the maids were already starting to clean the rooms, and it wasn't even 9 yet. I felt bad for people who tried to sleep in! Be sure to hang a Do Not Disturb sign on your door if you do plan to sleep in here. All in all, everything was fine and we would have returned here if we didn't have an early flight booked to return home. this hotel isn't as close to the airport as others are, which makes it maybe a bit quieter but it takes a bit longer to get to the airport, too.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive.”
Reviews.Author: SJSmithbc
Reviews.Content: The term 'Executel' is not helpful. I've stayed at many executive level hotels in Canada and the US - this does not fit in that category. While general cleanliness was not a problem, the overall impression was shabby, dated and in much need of renovation. We took 2 rooms for our party of 6: 2 adults and 4 kids, two of whom have special needs. Because of the special needs situation, we booked (a month in advance) one of the rooms with a rollaway so each person would have a bed. This was confirmed by phone a week before the trip. On arrival the desk clerk gave us our keys indicating which room had the rollaway. Getting to the room we discovered there was was space for a rollaway, but it was not in the room. A call to the desk got the reassurance that cots were only brought to the rooms after check in - it would be there soon. We went out for supper and on return called again to inquire when the rollaway would be delivered. "Very soon" we were assured. Took the kids to the pool and on returning to the room it was time to put them to bed so called again to ask about the cot. The rude and dismissive night manager told me it was far too late to ask for one, they were only available on a first come first served basis but he could bring some pillows so I could sleep on the floor. I don't expect hotels to fully appreciate or attempt to accommodate the challenges of traveling with special needs kids, but I do expect some degree of truth and courtesy when making a very common, basic request. I am certain this review will attract the classic management promise of a deeply fulfilling experience for my next stay. Given the level of competition in the area, that hardly seems likely.

Reviews.Title: “Bof, we find better among the best western”
Reviews.Author: wauk78
Reviews.Content: The room had a good size. Beds were ok, towels were not so cleaned, some turn to be yellow.It was very close to the airport so noisy. The restaurant was convenient but the food was not delightful and the waitresses were not friendly. So, if I have to recommend a best western not far from the airport, take the BW River"s Edge. It's better and close to malls.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaplusGrandpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights both before and after our Alaska cruise. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. They offer a shuttle service to and from the airport and will also take you and pick you up from local restaurants or the light rail that takes you into downtown Seattle. They also helped us secure transportation to and from the hotel to the cruise port. Complimentary continental breakfast is included with waffles, toasted items, cereal, and beverages. Computers are available in the business center. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: mistvale
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms staff was amazing great to get a group of people who are in the know . Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amenities for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jzb1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and staff were helpful in answering questions. We stayed in a room with a King bed that also included a desk and chair with ottoman. The room & bathroom were updated and clean overall (other than a water stain on the ceiling near the window). The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was well stocked with necessities. The A/C unit was noisy when running, but wasn't really an issue when sleeping at night since it cooled off enough not to really be necessary then. The breakfast that was included was better than I expected (when compared to a traditional continental). There was more of a variety of food items and they were restocked in a timely manner. The free hotel shuttle offered great access to the LightRail to take into Seattle. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: olstead
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed 4 nights in August 2011. We were in Seattle on vacation to watch the MLB at Safeco field and do some sight seeing and shopping. The location of the hotel is great, close to shopping and not that far from downtown either. Surprised that we could not hear the airplanes. The bed was fine, a bit firm for my taste but had no problems with it. Breakfast was the typical Best Western fare but a good start to the day and saves some money on breakfast. We would stay here again. Free parking and internet were a bonus we cant do without.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Blaliberte
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Executel in Seattle for 2 nights in July. Although it rained most of the time we found the staff and the shuttle drivers to be most friendly and helpful. We needed to stay near the airport so we didn't get to explore as much as we wanted to. The shuttle driver Leon was most helpful in advising us about what to do to get downtown, He took us back to the airport and told us how to use the train to downtown. We did go a few times but either it rained or we ran out of time.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: kyden
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online through a third party website and had it paid for before we arrived. When we checked out it appeared that everything was ok. A month later when the credit card bill arrived, the hotel had charged us for the room, so essentially we were charged twice! I had to call Best Western and have the charge removed. Needless to say it was not an easy process. It may have been a one time mistake on the hotel's behalf, but I remember it almost a year later! The hotel itself was decent - the breakfast was good, the room was clean, but the room view at the back looked out onto a construction site. I guess for the value and proximity to the airport it was not bad, but just make sure to check your charges when you check out!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff tries hard”
Reviews.Author: RachelB54
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, including the shuttle bus driver. The hotel offers basic amenities and also has a nice pool that we did not try out. The continental breakfast was extremely ample. Good place to stay if you need to be at the airport and want to pay low rates.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Don048
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a part of a fly, park and stay package. We spent two different nights...one going out and one coming back. The staff was friendly and accommating. The 24 hour shuttle to and from the Sea-Tac airport was prompt and with a friendly and accomodating driver....especially at midnight on our return flight arrival. Breakfast was very good with a a good variety. It is a very busy place,, but despite this it was still not disturbing at night.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: traverler7
Reviews.Content: This BW is close to Sea-Tac, but needs a face lift. it's heavily used by business travelers. The staff was very good and recommended the best local seafood restaurant Wally's Chowder House, 5 minutes away in Des Moines, Wa. The breakfast was the typical Comp. with lots of carbs. Rooms were clean, just tired

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel to stay for the night.”
Reviews.Author: hotelpwn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice stay for the night. The airport shuttle was timely and we got here soon enough. It's relatively far away from the airport, but is fast enough. The elevator is old and slow, even if we just wanted to go down one level. There is only one elevator. The rooms are average size and average quality. We did not visit the pool or other facilities due to our late arrival. The breakfast was very nice and was open for a very long time. There are shuttles every half hour. It's a place that we might return to.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: fulgulite
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our choice due to rice and close proximity to the SeaTac airport. Every staff member was friendly, helpful and cheerful. The hotel was very clean, well kept and had a nice indoor pool and small restaurant with reasonable food and pricing. We would definately stay here again----it runs a free shuttle to the airport every 30 minutes, and even books your seats so the shuttle is not overcrowded. Excellent price, location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: AmGeeFremont
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nice. Staff was good. We stayed here twice - one night each. They provide free continental breakfast which helped. There is also a free shuttle to and from the airport which is 5 minutes from here. And the airport now has a light rail to downtown so that is a very economical way to get to downtown from here. You can take the monorail from there to get to the space needle if needed.

Reviews.Title: “good value and a great shower”
Reviews.Author: zinfulone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to the close proximity to Sea-Tac airport after a late arrival. Check-in was easy, though the parking lot was relatively full. Surprisingly quiet despite being about 2 miles from the airport, only 2 planes heard overnight until about 6:30AM. Best feature was the great water pressure and consistent temperature of the shower. Continental breakfast included make your own waffles and a good variety of items incuding yogurt and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Needed work”
Reviews.Author: CindyV2
Reviews.Content: The website said 2 queen beds, but they were double, the top comforter was badly stained and there was not sufficient hot water for any of us to take a shower in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A very warm place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I was at the Executel for a whole week. During that week I was forced to make side trips to both Spokane and Boise, so I'm glad the hotel was near the airport. Some minor problems were overcome easily. First, one of the hotel's parking lots was being repaved, so late comers had to park across the street in a local business' lot (that's okay - they were really nice about it). Second, it rained every day I was there. How everyone at the desk stayed so cheerful is beyond me - because I listened to some of the guests crab and complain about minor stuff (like having to park across the street). Because of the constant rain we had, a lot of my cloths had to be dry cleaned and pressed. But at the end of my stay when I was clecking out, I asked for a bill for it and was told "That's okay -- it's on us." These are nice folks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: susanmartha
Reviews.Content: Great value, very clean rooms, tasty breakfast (not just continental!), staff was super friendly and helpful. Wish I had more reasons to stay here!! Absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for airport accessibility and service”
Reviews.Author: deejay2789
Reviews.Content: The front desk reception was quick and pleasant, the airport shuttle is prompt and often. The access from I-5 is easy and we plan to stay there anytime we fly out of Seatac..

Reviews.Title: “Average is good, Seattle is Close”
Reviews.Author: aWayfaringSwede
Reviews.Content: A 20 min drive from downtown Seattle. Rooms are big and clean. Breakfast is included and simple. No view, but a nice little pool.

Reviews.Title: “A good pick if you want generic comforts near the airport”
Reviews.Author: WendyAM
Reviews.Content: We were beginning a north west road trip in seattle so chose to stay in this hotel the first night after arriving from Chicago. It is minutes from the airport and parking and check in was easy. The room was well equipped - two full beds, desk,nightstand, open closet hanging space, tv and case stand. The bathroom was clean and well equipped and I liked the fact the shampoo, conditioner and gel were in dispensers over the bath - no fiddly containers or worries we would run out. The air conditioning was effective, if a little noisy. The aircraft noise didn't interrupt sleep, though the flights did start pretty early in the morning and were audible. All in all,a clean, more than basic hotel which is ideal if you're looking for something without individuality near to the airport. Friendly check in staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would won't to stay any place else in Seattle"”
Reviews.Author: TXbutterflies
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Best Western Airport Executel in Seattle Washington located two miles from the SeaTac airport. This is a very clean, very reasonably price, quiet, nonsmoking older hotel with lots of extras. The shuttle arrived very quickly after being called. We were quickly checked in by Elizabeth, who answered all our questions, and checked on the arrangements the hotel had made for our shuttle to Pier 91 the next morning. (Also reasonably priced) Our friends went to downtown, and we stayed to take care of some business via fax from the hotel. We dined in the hotel restaurant which had excellent service. Our friends came back bragging about the wonderful Ivars clam chowder they had. Well we had that too in the Executel restaurant, and it was delicious. I do not recommend the fish and chips (probably a Texan thing), but everything else was great. The complimentary breakfast was better than your average hotel breakfast. There was a nice place for us to play â€œ42â€� in the atrium overlooking the indoor pool. Every staff person we met was very friendly and helpful. We stayed there in 2008 and enjoyed the upgrades they have made. I didnâ€™t even have to sanitize the remote. They have a cover that fits over it, which was a nice surprise. We will definitely stay there again when we are in Seattle. We had asked for a handicapped room, but when we saw how far away it was (I use a walker) they gave us 108A which is a regular Queen. I had no problems. Check it out the hotel at: http://tinyurl.com/3kp7pxe

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: TraveledFarAndWide
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with my father, who has some issues and difficultly traveling. Jennifer checked us in and made arrangements for a rollaway bed. Immediately after getting to our room we had a problem---caused by one of us---that made the room undesirable. I went to the desk and talked to Jennifer and explained the situation. She immediately moved us to another room, moved the rollaway for us, and made sure we were settled in the new room. This was done in the most pleasant fashion with no indication of irritation. The facility was older and a bit tired, but quite acceptable. The internet did have some problems, until I connected to a different router, after which it worked well. Their restaurant converts to a breakfast buffet in the morning. It had a good variety, and the staff was quite attentive. I requested hot chocolate, and they said there was none, but if I could wait a few minutes they would make some. Less than five minutes later, they had a dispenser with hot chocolate out. As we were staying in the hotel a few days later, we asked if we could leave a few items and pick them up on our return. Again, they cheerfully issued claim tags and accommodated us. SeaTac is only a few minutes away, and a Safeway is convenient for stocking up on traveling supplies. We picked it for its location and price. I wouldn't have rated this hotel Excellent if not for superior service and great breakfast. We'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we love this place”
Reviews.Author: conablue
Reviews.Content: we live in bremerton washington we drive an hour just to stay in this hotel for the weekend because we love the cleanliness the area the pool and the hot tub--and the best part is in the morning the contintial breakfast is great everything is always fresh and you make your own waffles--amazing we love it and will be back many times the rest of the year! thank you best western

Reviews.Title: “Easy airport pickup and access, easy ride back, nice room, service, free internet & breakfast. Good Seatac Layover.”
Reviews.Author: AlaskanAir
Reviews.Content: It was priced fine with easy access to Seatac. I'd stay there again. For the price, many free amenities. Friendly staff, good service, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: kimbar58
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, with free breakfast and helpful staff. There was free use of a shuttle bus to local area restaurants, supermarkets, shopping malls and light rail (for visits into Seattle). In all good value for money and well recommended. Only downsides where there was some noise from the airport and a grumpy member of staff in the restaurant, but don't let that put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Old but good!”
Reviews.Author: Sgs0224
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old but the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The outside may not be pretty but there was nothing wrong with the inside. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet room, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: jogrow7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Airport Executel the night before we had to catch our plane to go home. The staff were great, except don't let an employee at the desk tell you that catching the 7:00 am shuttle bus to catch a 8:15 am flight is plenty of time! The shuttle bus will also take you to nearby restaurants and then pick you up, but we didn't have to use that service since we walked to a restaurant called The Bull Pen. The room was clean, quiet and the bed comfortable. The staff courteous. Took about 10 minutes to get to the Airport via the Hotel's shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price”
Reviews.Author: apollo12
Reviews.Content: Checked in to find the pool was out of order which was an anoyance after driving all day. Staff were friendly but looked stressed and overworked, particul;ary when having to deal with a large group comming off the shuttle bus. Room was small but adequate for one night and very noisy due to aircraft noise d=from SEATAC airport. Double glazed windows would be very useful at this hotel.. Great choice of TV chanels and the complimentary shuttle bus was excellent in taking us to local restaurants. Very good free breakfast in their restaurant with lots of choice. Hotel has 3 computers available to guests to check their emails at no extra charge. Queried about the pool on check out & mentioned that it had been out of order when we stayed 5 years ago. Receptionist told me that it always closed in May for refurbishment. Told her that we stayed in July last time & she was unable to respond to that. Very good hotel for the price & it's a lot cheaper than staying in Seattle itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Janab1000
Reviews.Content: Got a really good last minute deal. It isn't fancy, but it is super clean, the staff super friendly and accomodating. Even at the bar, the drinks were ample for a good price. Extended parking option while we were away on a cruise also offered great rates in comparison to nearby park n' fly's.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gal Natasha is!!!”
Reviews.Author: twodaynews
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made for a two queen bed handicapped room for 7 nights. We arrived and were presented with a one queen bed, in a very small handicapped room. No other options. My husband is on oxygen 24/7 and requires night mask, etc, so the night was not good. We decided to check out, and upon arrival at the desk, Natasha asked how our stay was, and I told her I was unhappy. She let me vent and then in the sweetest voice, said, "Didn't they tell you about room 180". At that point I thought it might be a bar and was ready to go. I was exhausted from a long drive, no sleep and the thought of moving all this equipment luggage, enough for a week, alone, again, was nothing I was looking forward to. I was whisked away to room 180 which was a dream come true, large enough for all his medical equipment, and room to walk around, a walk in tub, which was all we really needed insofar as help in the bathroom and we were in heaven. Our trip was unexpected, a death in the family, and to find someone who took the time to listen and help was a miracle. You have a gem in Natasha. I would recommend that you check with people who ask for handicapped rooms if the walk in shower is adequate for the handicapped needs. Also if the people who answer the phones could slow down. Many times we were calling on cell phones to make reservations and the road noise makes understanding difficult and they rattle off the name of the hotel very quickly. In one instance, we would have stayed at a Best Western, but were unable to understand the person because of language difficulties. Again Natasha is what every Best Western needs. Compassion, courtesy and knowledge of the property. What a Gal, Natasha.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: supertraveler65
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. All of our needs were met. Elizabeth and Jennifer were the best. They booked our tours for City of Seattle and Mount Rainer, provided all the necessary times to be in the lobby and checked when the bus was late. Chris, the waitress in the dinning room was the best. She is one of the most outstanding waitresses I have ever had in all of my travels. James and Daryl your shuttle bus drivers were always available, reliable, friendly, helpful and gave wonderful directions. I will highly recommend this hotel to my friends and co-workers. I will stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Worth a Stay”
Reviews.Author: rickis
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here on the way to a cruise. Free shuttle to and from airport, and light rail station. Decent location, though not near restaurants. There is a free shuttle to the mall, etc. If I were going on another cruise out of Seattle, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcomm1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 18th on a late night arrival and early morning departure out of Sea-Tac. Room was clean and comforable and quiet. Front desk staff were pleasant and friendly and the shuttle to and from the airport were quick and on time. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Used there Stay, Park and Fly Package”
Reviews.Author: hbulcock30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 9th for one night prior to flying out of SEA TAC. We used there 7 day stay park and fly. Stay 1 night and park your car for 7 days while you were away. Much cheaper then airport parking. When we pulled up I was a little nervous as the front part of the hotel was ripped apart. Looked like they were getting ready to start renos. We booked here as they offer a stay park package, free 24 hour shuttle and indoor pool. Upon arrival we found out the pool was closed, my son was very disappointed as this was one of the main reasons we booked here. Room was very clean. beds was comfortable. Front desk staff on check in were very friendly and efficent. We checked out on May 10th at 3am. We had a very early flight. The gentlemen checking us out was very rude and snappy with us. He tried to charge my cedit card a second time even though I pre paid on line. I had to go through my suite cases to get the proof which I had already provided at check in.
